content.question:
Last year the mean cost <math alttext="mu" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>μ</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for a one-bedroom rental in a certain city was $1,200 per month. Eli is looking for a one-bedroom apartment and is investigating whether the mean cost is less now than what it was last year. A random sample of apartments had a sample mean <math alttext="x bar" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover></mrow></mstyle></math> of $1,180 per month. Assuming all conditions for inference are met, Eli will conduct a hypothesis test as part of his investigation.
Which of the following is the correct set of hypotheses?

choices.label: <math alttext="H sub 0: mu equals 1,200. H sub a: mu is greater than 1,200" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mtext>,200</mtext></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo>></mo><mn>1</mn><mtext>,200</mtext></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H sub 0: mu equals 1,200. H sub a: mu is less than 1,200" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mtext>,200</mtext></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo><</mo><mn>1</mn><mtext>,200</mtext></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H sub 0: x bar equals 1,200. H sub a: x bar is less than 1,200" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mtext>,200</mtext></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover><mo><</mo><mn>1</mn><mtext>,200</mtext></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H sub 0: x bar equals 1,180. H sub a: x bar is not equal to 1,180" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mtext>,180</mtext></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover><mo>≠</mo><mn>1</mn><mtext>,180</mtext></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="H sub 0: x bar equals 1,180. H sub a: x bar is less than 1,180" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mtext>,180</mtext></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mover><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>¯</mo></mrow></mover><mo><</mo><mn>1</mn><mtext>,180</mtext></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="H sub 0: mu equals 1,200. H sub a: mu is less than 1,200" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mtext>,200</mtext></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><mi>μ</mi><mo><</mo><mn>1</mn><mtext>,200</mtext></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 7.4: Setting Up a Test for a Population Mean

skill.text: Skill 1.F: Identify null and alternative hypotheses.
